name: 陳盈竹
objective:
Overview
Based on Donald Norman's The Design of Everyday Things, this course explores key principles for designers to consider when interacting with users, focusing on their instinctive reactions and psychological effects. The course will also cover the Laws of UX, using psychological insights to enhance design communication and services. Research and discussion will be integral parts of classwork, and students are required to bring a laptop or tablet to each session.
schedule:
Class Outline
wk 1_Introduction
wk 2-3_Norman's Principles 
wk 4_Color Psychology
wk 5-8_Laws of UX Part One
wk 9_Mid-term Presentation
wk 10-16_Laws of UX Part Two
wk 17_Conclusion and Discussion
wk 18_Final Report Due
scorePolicy:
Evaluation
Class Exercises: 40%
Midterm Presentation: 25%
Final Report: 35%
materials: The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman, 2017
